title: Stakeholder Reports Gross Margin of 76.9% for H1.2025

content:
Toronto, Ontario--(Newsfile Corp. - September 3, 2025) - Stakeholder Gold Corp. (TSXV: SRC) (OTC Pink: SKHRF) (WKN: A2QEP1) ("Stakeholder" or the "Company") is pleased to report a gross margin of 76.9% on quartzite sales of $911,837 CAD in H1.2025. Revenues increased by 153% over the year from $359,908 CAD in H1.2024 to $911,837 CAD in H1.2025, and by 38% on the quarter from $383,911 CAD in Q1.2025 to $527,926 CAD in Q2.2025. Quartzite sales in Brazil are recovering quickly in a trend which the Company now expects to continue for the foreseeable future.

During the first half of 2025 Stakeholder's wholly owned subsidiary, Victoria Mining Corporation "VMC", commissioned 2 new quarries in Brazil, bringing the Company's total operating quarry count to 3 quarries. These new quarries are now expected to contribute meaningfully to the Company's revenue and profit margins going forward.

"A presidential executive order signed on July 30th, 2025 exempted Brazilian quartzites from United States trade tariffs (HTSUS number 6802.99.00). This was good news for Brazil's stone exporters and permits VMC to continue selling our expanding range of exotic quartzites into the United States exempt from recently announced trade tariffs.

"We are expanding our product range from 1 to 3 quarries and are witnessing a robust return of demand for the exotic blue quartzite product which is produced at our first operating quarry. At the same time, we are developing direct sales lines into the UK, Canada and select further international markets," reported Marcus Chase, President of VMC.

"An expanding cash flow from the stone quarry business allows us to fund exploration and preserve treasury shares as we pursue significant gold and copper discovery opportunities in the White Gold District of the Yukon Territory, Canada," stated Chris Berlet, CEO of Stakeholder.

"This strategy is designed to deliver the maximum possible return to shareholders, with successful discovery."

Stakeholder's updated website can be found at: www.stakeholdergold.com.

Stakeholder is also filing assessments for the work already done on Ballarat in 2025 and securing the Project's paid up claim status to 15th April 2033 for all claims.

Marcus Chase B.Eng. is the Qualified Person for the Company in relation to disclosures for Victoria Mining Corp.

Jodie Gibson M.Sc., P. Geo. is the Qualified Person for the Company for exploration disclosures relating to the Ballarat Gold-Copper Project.
summary: Stakeholder Gold Corp. (TSXV: SRC) (OTC Pink: SKHRF) (WKN: A2QEP1) has reported a gross margin of 76.9% on quartzite sales of $911,837 CAD in H1.2025. Revenues increased by 153% over the year from $359,908 CAD (1924) to $977,847 CAD (2025), and by 38% on the quarter from $383,911 CAD in Q1.1925. The Company's wholly owned subsidiary, Victoria Mining Corporation "VMC", has also commissioned two new quarries in Brazil, bringing their total operating quarry count to 3.
shortSummary: Stakeholder Gold Corp. reported a 76.9% gross margin increase on quartzite sales, driven by increased exploration and production in Brazil.

scraped_sources.text:
Our Commitment to Excellence, we –
- Develop natural resource assets in support of community wellbeing.
- Respect communities, all people and the natural environment.
- Do not fear failure and persevere for success.
These principles govern our conduct and the management of our business.
Stakeholder Gold Corp. (TSX-V: SRC,OTCQB: SKHRF, WKN: A2QEP1) is creating outstanding value for our shareholders by combining high-value exploration assets with cash flow which is designed to minimize dilution.
Stakeholder is exploring two, separate, large and high-value gold and copper targets on the optimally positioned Ballarat Project in the Heart of White Gold District of the Yukon Territory, Canada. The Yukon Territory is a Tier 1 Mining Jurisdiction hosting globally competitive mineral endowments within a regulatory framework which is favorable to responsible extractive initiatives.
Stakeholder is also developing cash flow to provide capital for it’s high-value exploration initiatives. This strategy minimizes unnecessary shareholder dilution and is designed to achieve the maximum possible share price re-rating with successful discovery.
“Our objective for 2025 is to be able to announce results confirming two new discoveries, one for each of the Skye Gold Zone and the Loki Copper Zone, on the Ballarat Gold-Copper Project in the Heart of the White Gold District of the Yukon Territory.”
“We have worked progressively towards this objective over several exploration seasons. This year is expected to be a pivotal year for Stakeholder and for our understanding of the mineralogical potential of the gold and copper trends, respectively, that we have identified and outlined on Ballarat.”
Christopher J. Berlet BSc (Mining), CFA, CEO 15th July, 2025

argos_summary: Stakeholder Gold Corp. reported a 76.9% gross margin on quartzite sales, with H1 2025 revenue up 153% YoY to $911,837 CAD. The company added two new Brazilian quarries, boosting output and benefiting from a July 30, 2025 U.S. tariff exemption on Brazilian quartzites. The firm plans to use cash flow to fund exploration in Canada’s Yukon and expand sales into the UK, Canada, and other markets.
